title: Docker Containers
description: Containerization with Docker - images, containers, Dockerfile, Docker Compose, and best practices

questions.question: What's the difference between a Docker image and a container?
options: Image is running, container is static
Image is a template, container is a running instance
questions.explanation: A Docker image is a read-only template used to create containers. A container is a running instance of an image.

questions.question: Which instruction in Dockerfile sets the base image?
questions.explanation: FROM instruction specifies the base image to use for the Docker image being built.

questions.question: What does the -d flag do when running docker run?
questions.explanation: The -d flag runs the container in detached mode (in the background), returning control to the terminal.

questions.question: Which command lists all running containers?
questions.explanation: docker ps lists all currently running containers. Use docker ps -a to see all containers including stopped ones.

questions.question: What's the purpose of .dockerignore file?
questions.explanation: .dockerignore excludes files and directories from the build context, reducing build time and image size.
